title: School-Based Arrest Data Request

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: School-Based Arrest Data Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

To whoever it may concern:

This letter constitutes a request pursuant to the Public Records Act, M. G. L.c.66, §10, for public records in the custody of your police department. Under the Criminal Justice Reform Act, school districts and law enforcement agencies must “specify the manner and division of responsibility for collecting and reporting the school-based arrests, citations and court referrals of students to the Department of Elementary and Secondary Education” (DESE). DESE began collecting data on school-related arrests in the 2018-19 school year. In the 2019-20 school year, DESE has expanded that collection to include data on all referrals to law enforcement. DESE has defined these terms as follows, borrowing the same definitions used by the U.S. Department of Education since its 2009 Civil Rights Data Collection.

A school-related arrest “[r]efers to an arrest of a student for any activity conducted on school grounds, during off campus school activities (including while taking school transportation), or due to a referral by any school official. All school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.”

A referral to law enforcement “[i]s an action by which a student is reported to any law enforcement agency or official, including a school police unit, for an incident that occurs on school grounds, during school-related events, or while taking school transportation, regardless of whether official action is taken. Citations, tickets, court referrals, and school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.”

I request the following public records, as defined in M. G. L.c. 4, § 7 (twenty-sixth):

1. An extract of your records management system or database that includes each school-related arrest and each referral to law enforcement conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022 school year (up until the day the records are produced). Specifically, we request an extract of the database to include the following columns:
a. Date of arrest or referral to law enforcement
b. Time of arrest or referral to law enforcement
c. Charge (or charges)
d. Whether the individual(s) was arrested or referred to law enforcement
e. Sex of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
f. Age of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
g. Race of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
h. Ethnicity of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
i. Disability status of the individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
j. Whether the individual arrested or referred to law enforcement is a student at the school.
k. Name of arresting officer, if applicable, and
l. Badge number of the arresting officer or the officer that referred the youth to law enforcement, as applicable.

2. If such an extract of the database in question 1 is not possible, please provide police reports and school incident reports on each school-related arrest conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022 school year (up until the day the records are produced).

3. Please provide an unduplicated count of arrested students for each school year including 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022 school year (up until the day the records are produced).

4. If such an extract of the database in question 1 is not possible, please provide police reports and school incident reports on each referral to law enforcement conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022 school year (up until the day the records are produced), per the U.S. Department of Education’s Civil Rights Data Collection for that year. For each referral to law enforcement, please include the school, demographic, and incident information described in DESE’s School Safety and Discipline Report Data Handbook v. 20.0.

5. Please also provide an unduplicated counts of referrals to law enforcement (as defined above) for each school year including 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022 school year (up until the day the records are produced).

6. A copy of any active memorandum of agreement and/or standard operating procedures between your police department and local school districts regarding police placement or activity in schools.

7. A copy of any active standard operating procedures developed with the police department and/or other law enforcement agencies regarding police placement or activity in your corresponding school; and,

8. Any records instructing or informing police personnel of, or otherwise describing, data reporting requirements and procedures for complying with M. G. L.c. 71 § 37P(b).

As this request involves a matter of public interest and will not be used for any commercial purpose, we ask that all fees associated with this request be waived pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(k). The purpose of this request is to determine whether your school district and police department are complying with their reporting obligations under the Criminal Justice Reform Act. “The public has an interest in knowing whether public servants are carrying out their duties in an efficient and law-abiding manner.”

It would be ill-advised to impose a fee for data that your police department may have failed to report in violation of statutory and regulatory duty. Moreover, as you know, municipalities with a population of over 20,000 may not assess a fee for the first 2 hours of time spent searching for, compiling, segregating, redacting and reproducing a requested record. Finally, pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(i), a records access officer shall assess no fee greater than the lowest hourly rate of a person capable of compiling, segregating, redacting and reproducing a requested record. In the event that a charge is incurred for this request which you will not waive, please so indicate and include an itemization of estimated good faith costs.

Please provide public records to a requestor in an electronic format unless the record is not available in an electronic format. M. G. L.c 66, § 6A(d).

The Public Records Act requires that you comply with this request within ten (10) business days following receipt. If you believe that documents or data responsive to any request herein is not public record and thus not subject to disclosure, please set forth in writing the specific reasons for such assertion, including the specific exemption or exemptions that you believe apply. To the extent that you determine that records need to be redacted in order to be produced under any law protecting the privacy of named individuals, please do so rather than withholding them in their entirety.

If you have any questions about this request, or need additional time to respond, please contact me. Thank you in advance for your prompt response to this request.

Sincerely,
Katherine Stathulis, Esq.

J.D. Fellow

Center for Public Interest, Advocacy, and Collaboration

k.stathulis@northeastern.edu

614.551.8426

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kayla Fox

Donna Dutton

173 Bedford St.

title: Public Information Request: ShotSpotter Data

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Public Information Request: ShotSpotter Data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) ALERT DATA: A list, database, or comparable record of every alert that has been generated by the department's ShotSpotter technology since time of implementation through December 31st, 2023. For instance, if ShotSpotter was implemented in the city on January 1, 2008, I would like all ShotSpotter data from this date to December 31st, 2023. The list/database should include, where possible, the date, time, location (address or latitude+longitude coordinates), single or multiple shot distinction, whether the shots were confirmed, police district located, and associated case number for each alert.
2) ACTIVATION DATES: Documents sufficient to show the dates that ShotSpotter microphones were activated by district.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

e

communications.subject: Public Information Request :: O123015-042424
communications.communication:
Dear e e: 
 
Thank you for your interest in public records of the Harris County Sheriff’s Office. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with Chapter 552 of Texas Government Code, the Public Information Act. Your request was given the reference number O123015-042424 for tracking purposes. 
 Records Request Details: 
Type of Records Requested: Other 
 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant County department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. 
 PLEASE NOTE: The Texas Public Information Act does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
 
 
Harris County Sheriff's Office

title: Henderson Police Department, Nevada Request

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Henderson Police Department, Nevada Request
communications.communication:
To Whom it may concern,
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:
Any and all records from the past year regarding your nuisance property ordinance that will be referred to as ordinance in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as Property Maintenance Code as described in Chapter 15.12 of the city code.
Please provide any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) regarding the Ordinance including but not limited to:
• police calls, reports, citations, or arrests, collected by the municipality police department for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request.
Sincerely,
Jenny Wadhwa

communications.subject: RE: City of Henderson case number efm 24-749686
communications.communication:
Hello Jenny, 

Upon review of your request, we have found that Property Maintenance Code covers a wide range of items. Please be aware that due to the scope of our search capabilities, you might be charged for items that may not be directly related to your query.  I have attached some information regarding the Crime Free Housing Program which may satisfy your request. If you still feel you would like to obtain more information, please respond to the questions below. 

In response to your request for calls, arrests, citations, etc. Could you please provide a desired time frame for this information? Once we obtain that information from you, we can assess the time required to compile the information and provide an estimate for this portion of the request. 

In response to your request for emails, document, memos, etc., a search would need to be conducted in our email archive system which requires a date range and key phrases, names, or email addresses to search. Which search parameters would you like us to use to conduct this search? Once we run that search and receive the quantity of records, we can provide an estimate for that portion of the request. 

The City of Henderson maintains an Open Data portal that allows you to search for items related to Property Maintenance Code or any term you deem relevant. It can be reached at: Search Meeting Content - OnBase Agenda Online (hylandcloud.com) . A search for the phrase "Property Maintenance Code" in the last year returned three meetings with agenda packets, thousands of pages of information and attachments. The site does take some time to load, so please be patient. (https://email.mg.comcate.com/c/eJwUzD1yhDAMQOHTmC6MJMv2unBBQ5fcwSPLsLP8BUyR22eoXvPmK8mL2mg7TRjQBYgeQzenKswcySmHWqMrBVz2VasnKS-psXsnAmJwyPgCQOrJSvAZKhfKMbI1DOvUy75Kbvq0W9Lc2nEZOxgaDY2zbkXPa9_6-W_JW5Flv8tzGhoJ7HAcP9qGSbeSDY3fqu29TVd3JvT4CvjlokfvKBqGU39vvdrVr7d8zl0-D_MfAAD__wG1Qks) 

Under
Henderson Municipal Code 2.47.085, if a public records request will require
more than 30 minutes to complete, the City may charge a research fee in
accordance with the City-wide Public Records and Document Services Fee
Schedule. ORDINANCE NO (cityofhenderson.com) (https://email.mg.comcate.com/c/eJwUzT2OwyAQQOHT4G6tmQEPUFBswz34mSxR4pA1WNbefpXqNU_6auAi2utFAlrcLHhGu7RAVrThBCAZOOuUSk4lV8_bJowuL_dAQAY2NOgAkFbSxXKCm6mUvDdaGdh_1tL3kqZ8ujxDm_M9lP5WFBXF67rWcp9__dbkVeUY_fX5FMXWd1EUR-vX-8zP-2hSay_nLq-pKKJmAEWRtTPegGFnndYAAMsRkNFZ_No8I2_klYFDfk8Zc6z7WR5HL4-P8h8AAP__wR1JhQ) 

Please let me know how you would like to proceed by May 23rd, or this request will be resolved. 
Thank you, 

Gina Waters 
Public Records Officer

https://clients.comcate.com/myfeedbackView.php?view=2108519&id=90

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All contracts, acquisition agreements, memoranda of understanding, and any other agreements in possession of the Office of the State Comptroller signed between:
- New York state government agencies
- and the company known as Cobwebs Technologies, aka Cobwebs, aka Cobwebs America,
- from January 1, 2023 to the present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chris Gelardi

title: US Census Bureau Special Census Applications January 2024

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: US Census Bureau Special Census Applications January 2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A list or log (if one exists) of special census applications received between 2019 and present.
2. An electronic copy in PDF format of special census applications received between 2019 and present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brandon Galbraith

title: Fresno Police Department, Fresno, CA Request

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Fresno Police Department, Fresno, CA Request
communications.communication:
To Whom it may concern,
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:
Any and all records from the past year regarding your nuisance property ordinance that will be referred to as ordinance in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as Management of Real Property Ordinance as described in Chapter 10, Article 7 of the city code.
Please provide any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) regarding the Ordinance including but not limited to:
• police calls, reports, citations, or arrests, collected by the municipality police department for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request.
Sincerely,
Jenny Wadhwa

title: Former Employee Robert Dorman Reports and Videos Release Request

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Former Employee Robert Dorman Reports and Videos Release Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All reports to include offense/incident, information, and supplement reports, written by former employee Robert Dean Dorman (1814) that are releasable by law, i.e. no longer related to criminal investigation, etc. I also hereby request copies of all body worn camera and vehicle dash camera video from any device to include vehicles assigned to or used by Dorman, even if temporarily so, that was recorded between the hours of 1700-0500, during years 2015-2018, and is longer than four minutes but shorter than 31 minutes. I prefer the reports and videos in digital format stored on a portable drive as possible, or as explained below. I also hereby request an itemized fee schedule to approve for the filling of this request before producing the requested items, or information concerning fees and total charges as explained below.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert D. Dorman

communications.subject: [Records Center] Police Department Information Request :: P036462-041824
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

RE: REQUEST FOR INFORMATION - Reference # P036462-041824 

Dear Robert D. Dorman, 
On April 19, 2024 you submitted a request for information referenced as P036462-041824. We are attempting to clarify an unclear or overbroad request.  Specifically, “reports to include offense/incident, information, and supplement reports, written by former employee Robert Dean Dorman (1814) that are releasable by law, i.e. no longer related to criminal investigation, etc.” A list of calls for service, offense/incident reports and arrest reports in which Mr. Dorman is the primary or arresting officer is available via the link below.  Please review and advise if this is the information you are requesting in response to this request.   If not, please indicate the capacity (primary, arresting, assisting, transporting, etc) of Mr. Dorman’s involvement and the specific type of information you are requesting. Government Code, this request is considered withdrawn if you do not respond in writing to this correspondence within 61 days of the date of this correspondence. You may send your response via: 
 
  *  This email 
  *  Fax:972-941-2191 
  *  US Mail: 
 
  *  Plano Police Department, PO Box 860358, Plano, TX75086, In person: 
 
  *  909 14 th Street, Plano, TX 75074 Monday-Friday (7am-7pm); or Saturday (8am-12pm) 
  *  7501A Independence, Plano, TX 75023 Monday-Friday (8am-5pm) 
  *  4640 McDermott Rd, Plano, TX75024 Monday-Friday (8am-5pm) Correspondence is also being sent to you via the US Postal Service #9589 0710 5270 0443 8251 37. 
Sincerely, 

Police Open Records 

Open Records

communications.subject: RE: Texas Public Information Act Request #P036462-041824
communications.communication:
The initial request is for “All reports to include offense/incident, information, and supplement reports, written by former employee Robert Dean Dorman (1814) that are releasable by law, i.e. no longer related to criminal investigation, etc. I also hereby request copies of all body worn camera and vehicle dash camera video from any device to include vehicles assigned to or used by Dorman, even if temporarily so, that was recorded between the hours of 1700-0500, during years 2015-2018, and is longer than four minutes but shorter than 31 minutes.”

What was provided is “A list of calls for service, offense/incident reports and arrest reports in which Mr. Dorman is the primary or arresting officer. “

That is not the information requested.   The initial request indicated Mr. Dorman’s capacity as reporting officer (RP) and the specific type of information requested as “all reports” and “video” involving Mr. Dorman in that capacity, NOT a list thereof. 

Please read carefully and don’t delay further.

communications.subject: RE: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Staff Communications between Jeremy Rowlands, Jeremy Rowlands, Jason Cook and individual Suzanne Harris
communications.communication:
Mr. Passmore,

We have reviewed the emails you have requested below.  There are no text messages or emails between the individuals listed pertaining to “obtaining access to the account or accounts of Chas Galloway.”
There are emails that appear to be day-to-day operations concerning the issuance of cell phones and iPads to staff, maintenance for landlines and internet, and setting up staff accounts with usernames and passwords.  These emails will require redactions of passwords and/or other sensitive information in order to release.
To fulfill this request, there will be a special service charge of $89.85 for 5.00 hours of labor at $17.97 per hour for review and redaction of all protected information.

If you would like for us to proceed with your request, please forward a payment to our office in the amount of $89.85 or you may contact us at (850) 892-8110 to pay by phone with a credit card.

We are continuing to process your remaining outstanding requests.

Sincerely,


Genara Roop
Records Management Liaison Officer
Walton County Board of County Commissioners
Office of the County Attorney
161 E. Sloss Avenue
DeFuniak Springs, Florida  32433
